Strategically, we will respond “minimally” to a release. Under this plan we will call emergency personnel and evacuate the facility. All response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 

Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella continually strives to improve in all areas, including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella’s ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella’s management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. mechanical integrity inspection, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.
In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year.It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.
Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep an active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.4 Five Year Accident History

Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella’s emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:

Cal/OSHA’s Emergency Action Plan – Title 8 CCR §3220
U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans - Title 29 CFR §1910.38
Cal/OSHA’s Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements] – Title 8 CCR §5189(n)
U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration’s (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements]- Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] – Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 §2765.1-2765.2
USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements] - Title 40 CFR §68.95
California Hazardous Materials Business Plan (HMBP) [Emergency Response Plans

Once the liquid has evaporated to form low temperature and pressure vapor, it travels back to the accumulators, through a suction return line, and into the main suction accumulator. Any remaining liquid falls to the bottom of the vessel and is fed by gravity into the transfer vessel. Inside the transfer vessel, the liquid rises in temperature and is returned to each high pressure receiver as high pressure liquid. From the main suction accumulator, the remaining low pressure vapor is piped to the suction inlet on the reciprocating compressors.

The compressors compress the low pressure vapor, and it exits through the discharge outlet as a high pressure and high temperature vapor. The vapor is then sent to the evaporative condensers where it is cooled and liquefied. The condenser uses air and water to cool the warm ammonia as it passes through a series of tubes within the condenser. As the cooling medium of air and water draws the heat from the vapor, the refrigerant condenses into a liquid and flows to each high pressure receiver. Each receiver serves as a holding tank for the liquid refrigerant being fed to the low side, and holds the bulk of the refrigerant in the system when it is not operating.
 
Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella is treated as a single process.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the ammonia refrigeration p

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

Facility Layout
Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella operates a commercial cold storage/food processing plant for nuts in Ducor, CA. The facility has an ammonia refrigeration system that provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
 
(11) Rooms
(2) Precool Rooms
(1) Hallway
(1) Shipping Dock
 
Refrigeration System Equipment

The refrigerated spaces are equipped with air-cooling evaporators and accumulators as required for flooded operation.

Most control valve groups are located on the roof to provide easy access. The refrigeration machinery is contained within or directly above the machinery room. 

Process Chemistry

The refrigeration system employed at Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella is a flooded system. In this system, high pressure liquid from each high pressure receiver is piped to multiple accumulators. Each accumulator is equipped with an expansion valve which expands the high pressure liquid into a low temperature and pressure liquid as it enters the accumulator. Each accumulator either feeds two ceiling suspended evaporator coils located in the North Hallway/Shipping Dock, or multiple bunker mounted evaporator coils located in the Precool/Storage Rooms. The evaporators contain a set of continuous coils through which the low pressure liquid flows. Due to the low pressures and temperatures maintained in the evaporator, the liquid refrigerant absorbs a great deal of heat from the surrounding area and evaporates. To increase the rate of heat removed, the evaporator uses an electric fan to move warm air over the coils of cold liquid ammonia.

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program – Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP) – Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a “living document”. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Setton Pistachio of Terra Bella has updated/developed their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following process which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                      | Process Chemical                | Process Quantity(lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration      Anhydrous Ammonia           29,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.
